dv1_OE_game_satisfaction: Yes. Any extra earnings made through the game are purely a bonus payout. Since player 2 has no choice to pass the ball to me, nor is there any incentive to do so, even getting one pass to the treasurer is a bonus akin to finding money on the ground.
dv1_oe_playtime_satisfaction: Yes. I have no control over how many times the ball gets passed to me. Moreover, there is no logical reason for dissatisfaction. My answer would likely be different if there was some incentive to pass the ball between players. For example, there is a bigger point benefit to SP1 if SP2 passes to SP1 first, then SP1 passes to the treasurer.
dv1_oe_earnings_satisfaction: Yes. For the same reasons stated above, and sum of money above zero is purely unearned, bonus money. The game has no element of skill or teamwork involved. It is solely up to luck and how the Treasurer passes the ball. Furthermore, there was no initial buy-in from SP1 so it is impossible to not come out ahead.
dv1_oe_treasurer_behavior: It doesn't matter. I have literally no way to affect how the treasurer passes the ball around. If I could fully control the game, I would have the treasurer pass the ball evenly between SP1 and SP2. Seeing as this is not the case, I expected nothing and do not wish for things to have been done differently.
dv1_oe_sp2_behavior: Assuming that SP2 was bound by the same rules as SP1, namely that passes can only be made to the Treasurer, there is nothing about SP2's behaviour that is to be like nor disliked. I do not wish they had done differently either because I also got the ball a few times.
dv1_oe_message_to_treasurer: The way the Treasurer played did not affect me in any way. If I had received zero passes, thus, zero bonus payout, there would have been an actual demerit in having wasted time just watching SP2 and the Treasurer pass the ball back and forth. However, this was not the case. If I had to say something, I might ask why the Treasurer distributed passes that way.
dv1_oe_message_to_sp2: Again I would not have anything to say because SP2's play during the game does not affect me in any way. The only person who can control my payout and score is the Treasurer. But getting even one pass between SP1 and the Treasurer is a net positive so there is no downside regardless of how few passes I get.

SP2 could have easily chosen not to pass to me, in which case I would have not tied with SP2 on the scoreboard.

dv1_OE_game_satisfaction: I am not satisfied with how the game went for me.  I felt like it was a one sided game where the Treasurer mostly gave the ball to SP2.  I thought that it was unfair and wished the ball came my way so I could actively engage in the game.

dv1_oe_earnings_satisfaction: I was not satisfied with how much money that I made.  I was eager to play more to earn more money. It seemed just the 2 players were playing and then were able to earn more.  I would have liked to had more money with more plays coming my way.
dv1_oe_treasurer_behavior: I feel that I didn't have much chances with how the Treasurer threw the ball to SP2 the majority of the game. I wish the Treasurer would have thrown me the ball many more times instead of me just sitting there watching them play and me not able to be involved.

dv1_OE_game_satisfaction: I am satisfied with the game. It was an interesting experience. I was curious if the other player would ever throw me the ball, so I threw it to them just to see what would happen. The other player got the ball about three times more than I did. After I threw the ball to player 2, I did not get the ball again. While playing the game, I reflected on the way our society distributes wealth and resources. The game reminded me of some dynamics in our society.
dv1_oe_playtime_satisfaction: I found it interesting that the game was not fair, in that each player did not receive the ball from the Treasurer an equal number of times. Since I received the ball fewer times, I was less satisfied than if I had gotten the ball an equal number of times or more than player 2.
dv1_oe_earnings_satisfaction: The monetary reward wasn't high enough to get super invested in the outcome financially. I decided to reduce player 2's winnings at the cost of my own just to see what it would feel like to go against my instinct to keep my winnings and let the other player keep theirs. It felt very unnatural for me to go against my usual urge to find fairness or accept outcomes.
dv1_oe_treasurer_behavior: I noticed that they did not throw the ball equally to each player. In a "real" game, I would think it was super inappropriate since I expect games to be fair. I would dislike it very much if it seemed one player was getting an unfair advantage, and I did have some of those thoughts during the game.
dv1_oe_sp2_behavior: I wasn't sure what to expect from player 2. I did not have the same expectations of them as the Treasurer, I did not expect them to be impartial to the outcome. Although the instructions did describe the Treasurer as a player, not an official so maybe my expectations of them aren't necessarily appropriate.
dv1_oe_message_to_treasurer: If your role was meant to be unbiased, it was definitely not. Games are usually more fun if everyone sees that they are fair and this game did not seem fair. I am not sure what your role was really meant to be, so I will give you the benefit of the doubt.
dv1_oe_message_to_sp2: You could have passed the ball to me a few times so that I would have a chance to play. I chose to make our winnings closer to even, since the game seemed pretty unfair. I supposed you may have done the same if the Treasurer favored me in the game instead of you.

dv1_OE_game_satisfaction: No, I thought that the treasurer was keeping the ball away from me, they kept passing it to SP 2. I felt that it forced me to pass the ball to the treasurer after SP 2 passed it to me, I felt that I left out of the game because I wasn't receiving the ball much.
dv1_oe_playtime_satisfaction: I wasn't really satisfied because I didn't get to receive the ball much, it was kind of boring, just waiting for the ball, but the treasurer didn't pass the ball towards me as much as I wanted it. So I felt left out, so it was kind of boring just waiting for the ball.
dv1_oe_earnings_satisfaction: Yes, it's okay, it's only 40 cents I think, it's a good amount of bonus, the other player sp2 received the same so it was fair for both of us. A 40 cent bonus is okay, it's not a lot, but it's something. I think it's fair because we both got the same amount.
dv1_oe_treasurer_behavior: I think the treasurer favored the sp2 player because they were passing them the ball more and I wasn't getting the ball passed towards me, and so I ended up disliking it greatly because I felt left out. I think the game was rigged in favor of the other person.
dv1_oe_sp2_behavior: They were nice to me, I think that they felt bad that I wasn't getting the ball as much as they were, so they passed me the ball to make it fair for both of us. I think sp2 was a good person because they balanced everything out between us.
dv1_oe_message_to_treasurer: I would tell them to make the game fair and pass the ball to both of us, it would make things equal, the game wouldn't feel rigged. I would tell them to treat everyone fair because it's not fair to exclude someone in the game because they want the bonus too.
